stages.logText: Temporary placeholder.
Level 0
Level 1
Vine taken.
Vine placed.
First corpse discovered
Second corpse discovered
Third corpse discovered
Torture signs discovered
Keyfield on Bwm29
Conversation with Ehrenfest starts before Ortholion appears.
Conversation with Ehrenfest starts after Ortholion leaves.
Ehrenfest notices your presence in the mine and calls you.
Prim's Evoker info.
Moyra's info.
Wellspring dialogue & hole.
One bottle of water.
Middle point conversation with Jern.
Choice (Ehrenfest vs Jern)
Cabin warning
Cabin compulsory exploration.
Jern vs Guard Captain
Jern & Guard Cap. convo.
Subdued Feygard mountain scout
Ortholion's kick.
Arghest small talk.

Down in a hole, in the mountain side near Prim I've found signs of a heinous torture. At least three corpses were there. I felt the urge of getting out of there as far as I could and report the events to someone in the village inmediately.
A mysterious looking guy appeared on a sudden in my way to report the guards. He has recommended me not to tell them.
I ignored the advices of the strange guy that almost stumbled upon me. I must see some guards.
Somehow, a Feygard general and his men reached Prim. They are kind of extorting the people in charge to get the full control of the Elm mine.
The man in charge is not willing to hear me. They seem to have bigger problems right now. Maybe the guy I met earlier was right.
A Feygard general and two henchmen of him appeared. They must be up to no good.
Ehrenfest is uneasy. He said we must meet in Elm mine, West of prim. We should talk no more about this inside the village.
Ehrenfest told me his story, and why he knew about what I saw on the mountain side, but he didn't dare to go down the hole.
I explained to Ehrenfest the horrible scene, and showed him a proof of the torture. Poor guys...
I must ask the villagers about Lorn and his partners, maybe I can gather some useful information from the common gossip.
It seems Lorn was a regular client of the tavern. I should ask there.

One of the tavern regulars, possibly a Lorn's old partner, could not believe about the accident, maintaining Lorn has been climbing the mountains for longer he could remember. However, he does not feel alright to keep the conversation.
Lorn's old partner asked me to bring a large bottle of cool water from the streams, down the hole East of Prim. I bet it is the same hole I've been earlier.
I've taken enough water for that drunkard. Time to leave this dark place.
I brought the cold water to Lorn's old partner. He seems to be better, and his intoxication has relieved.
Jern doesn't know anything about a missing couple. How does a member of Lorn's crew ignore the mission of his group? Something does not fit again. I should visit Ehrenfest again.
I decided to solve this situation by myself, as Ehrenfest proved not to be trustworthy enough.
Despite Ehrenfest ostensible lies, I decided to give him a second chance.
It's settled. Ehrenfest and I will reach blackwater Settlement and stop General Ortholion's evil plan.

I've found a severely wounded guy inside a mountain cabin. She claims having being attacked by a group of wyrms in a sudden. Ortholion and the other scout left her resting and departed to Blackwater Settlement.
I killed the mountain scout that was taking refuge in the old cabin up in the mountain.
I talked again with Jern. Maybe guards will be more reasonable if he talks with them instead of me.
It seems Ehrenfest lied to me in more than one thing. He's probably related with the missing people and Lorn's death. I must find General Ortholion and warn him about Ehrenfest.
One of the general's henchmen attacked me without provocation. There was something wrong with her. Better hurry up and meet with the Feygar general.
Ehrenfest revealed his true intentions, but fled before getting surrounded. According with his own words, he will be waiting for General Ortholion in the Elm mine.

After a brief conversation with the general, he left Blackwater settlement in a rush to reach Elm mine. He seemed really worried about the mine, so he asked me to warn his soldiers, settled South of Prim.
I reported general's henchmen about his plans. Now, I should hurry up to the Elm mine.
